summary: Build a fruit image classification app where users upload fruit images and the app returns the fruit type, related information, and a freshness assessment.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page UI that lets a user upload (or drag-and-drop) an image of a fruit (JPG/PNG/WebP), shows a preview, and provides a clear call-to-action to run classification.
Implement client-side fruit classification that analyzes the uploaded image in the browser and outputs a predicted fruit type with a confidence score, without calling any external AI/ML services.
Assess freshness from the uploaded image in the browser and display a freshness result (e.g., Fresh / Ripe / Overripe / Spoiled) along with a short explanation of the detected visual indicators.
Display fruit information for the predicted fruit type, including a short description and a small set of facts (e.g., common varieties, taste profile, storage tips, typical ripeness cues).

Add an optional “Save result” feature that stores analysis results (timestamp, predicted fruit, confidence, freshness rating, freshness confidence) in the Motoko backend and provides a “History” list for the current user.

Apply a coherent visual theme and layout for the app (colors, typography, spacing, cards, and states like loading/error/empty) with a distinct style suitable for a produce/food utility app (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).

Add a more interactive analysis experience by showing a visible, step-based progress UI while an image is being analyzed (e.g., “Loading image”, “Extracting colors”, “Classifying fruit”, “Assessing freshness”) and keep the UI responsive with clear loading/disabled states.

Make the results area more interactive by adding an optional “Details” / “How we decided” expandable section that lets users inspect the reasoning behind the freshness and fruit classification in a structured way using the already-available result fields (confidence values and freshness explanation).

Make History interactive by allowing users to click a saved history entry to load it back into the main results view (and fruit info card) as the “active” analysis result, without requiring a new upload or re-analysis.

Improve the uploader interactions beyond basic drag-and-drop by adding at least two additional, intuitive input interactions: (1) click anywhere in the dropzone to open the file picker, and (2) support pasting an image from the clipboard into the uploader when no file is selected.

new_feature_requests.summary: Allow users to upload fruit images for classification
Classify uploaded fruit image to determine fruit type
Display fruit information based on classified fruit type
Assess and report freshness of the uploaded fruit image
Make the app UI more interactive (enhanced interactions/feedback beyond basic upload and results)

projectName: Fruit image classification with freshness assessment from uploaded photos
